replies.bodyText: updated to say Jakarta Server Faces
replies.author: volosied

timeline.bodyText: Is this something new added to the latest jakarta CDI/Faces?
timeline.author: pnicolucci

replies.bodyText:
These files were out of date, so I updated them as part of this new feature. I can undo these changes, and do them in a separate PR if you still want these updates.  (Or I can just create a new issue and link this PR to it).
You can find these files here: https://github.com/weld/core/tree/master/modules/jsf/src/main/java/org/jboss/weld/module/jsf
This particular change you commented on was part of WELD-2512 if you look at the commit history.
replies.author: volosied

timeline.author: volosied
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,8 @@
+# This private feature corresponds to using a JSF-providing feature
+# with just a container and no implementation (e.g. jsfContainer-3.0)
+-include= ~${workspace}/cnf/resources/bnd/feature.props
+symbolicName=io.openliberty.facesProvider-3.0.0.Container
+singleton=true
+visibility=private
+kind=noship
+edition=core

timeline.bodyText: Let me know I need any other changes to this description.
timeline.author: volosied

+
+description=This feature enables CDI integrations for web applications that use the Jakarta Server Faces \
+ (JSF) 3.0 framework. This feature only includes container integration code for JSF, and does \
+ not include any JSF interfaces or implementation.  To use this feature, JSF interfaces and implementation \
+ must be packaged within web applications that use JSF.

timeline.bodyText:
Didn't work when I tested. I'm assuming this is a bug with the RC implementation.
Maven Repo only has RC3 as the latest, but github says RC5 was released 2 days ago.
#14533
